sentence.Network_en: Strangely enough, you will automatically wake up after this length of time.
sentence.Network_cn: 奇怪的是，过了这样一段时间你就会自己醒来。

sentence.Network_en: He felt strangely exhilarated by the brisk, blue morning.
sentence.Network_cn: 那个凉爽而晴朗的早晨让他异常兴奋。

sentence.Network_en: The audience are strangely subdued, clapping politely after each song.
sentence.Network_cn: 观众们出奇地安静，只是在每首歌结束后报以礼貌性的掌声。

entry.tran: (表示强调)奇怪地，异常地，不可思议地
entry.def: You use strangely to emphasize that what you are saying is surprising.

example.ex: Strangely, the race didn't start until 8.15pm...
example.tran: 很奇怪，赛跑直到晚上 8 点 15 分才开始。

example.ex: No, strangely enough, this is not the case.
example.tran: 不，说来也怪，事情不是这样的。

means.word_mean: 奇妙地;不可思议地;怪异地

sentences.en: Strangely enough,I said the same thing to my wife only yesterday.
sentences.cn: 说也奇怪,我就在昨天也同妻子谈到这件事。

sentences.en: The air was strangely still and silent.
The girl who checked me out looked at me strangely.
sentences.cn: 给我结账的姑娘奇怪地打量了我一下。
